== Concept ==
After a [http://www.cell.com/current-biology/abstract/S0960-9822(10)01281-9 Nov 2010] article in the journal Current Biology (no pun intended I'm sure) brought to our attention the technique of running a small amount of DC current across the surface of the head to induce positive (or negative) effects. It's our intention to build a device similar to the [http://www.neuroconn.de/en/solutions/dc-stimulator_en/ one used in the study], and attempt to reproduce the findings.

== To Do ==
1. Design a current delivery circuit.
**Must be variable from 0-2mA minimum over a variable human head load.
**Random samples of head resistance across Parietal lobes seems to be 300K-3M Ohms. Need better understanding of this variability.
2. Design/program a delivery controller.
**Should obfuscate the R-L, L-R, and sham groups in digital programming.
**Need the ability to vary the current circuit over time by ramping up the current from 0-1mA over 20-30seconds and ramp back down down similarly. 
**Need the ability to time the delivery for 30sec-1hr.
3. Produce BoM order parts and build devices. 
**At least 3 devices for the 3 groups.
4. Design Study
**Is there a test that mimics the numerical Stroop paradigm for abstract numerical symbol learning?
**Can the study be performed in groups, or does it need to be one at a time?
**What other factors need to be ruled out?
**How do we make it double blind? 3rd party to program controllers and number them?
**[http://www.xtranormal.com/watch/6871831/ Can I use 3 subjects?]
5. Find study participants
